{{Infobox person | name = Santiago Maldonado | image = Santiago Maldonado.JPG | birth_name = Santiago Andrés Maldonado | birth_date = 25 July 1989 | birth_place = Buenos Aires, Argentina | death_date = 1 August 2017 (aged 28) | death_place = Chubut, Argentina | nationality = [[Argentines|Argentine]] }}
The '''Santiago Maldonado case''' refers to the death of an Argentine demonstrator, who took part in a road block and was missing after the Argentine gendarmerie dispersed the demonstration. Maldonado's body was found months later in a nearby river with no signs of violence. The events took place in [[Cushamen Department|Cushamen]], located in the [[argentina|Argentine]] province of [[Chubut Province|Chubut]]. The autopsy of the body indicated that Santiago's cause of death was "drowning by immersion in the water of the [[Chubut River]], contributed by hypothermia" and that it was a "traumatic death" and there were no signs of violence. The [[autopsy]] also showed that the body had stayed underwater for at least 55 days.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-santiago-maldonado-penas-falso-testimonio-varios-testigos-quedan-expuestos_0_HJ4qRbK6b.html|title=Caso Santiago Maldonado: las penas por falso testimonio a las que varios testigos quedan expuestos|access-date=2017-10-21}}</ref> The law-enforcement action was carried out by the [[Argentine National Gendarmerie]], a security force that operates under the direct command of the National Security Minister, [[Patricia Bullrich]], under the control of President [[Mauricio Macri]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/54576-cuarto-dia-sin-maldonado|title=Cuarto día sin Maldonado {{!}} Silencio del Gobierno por la desaparición|date=2017-08-05|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-AR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/54964-macri-ya-tiene-su-desaparecido|title=Macri ya tiene su desaparecido {{!}} El gobierno nacional pasa del negacionismo a la represión|last=Verbitsky|first=Horacio|date=2017-08-07|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-AR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://encuentrojudicial.com.ar/?p=10434|title=Encuentro Judicial {{!}}|website=encuentrojudicial.com.ar|language=es-ES|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2056617-entrevista-a-los-padres-de-santiago-maldonado-donde-esta-que-le-hicieron-lo-estamos-esperando|title=Entrevista a los padres de Santiago Maldonado: "¿Dónde está? ¿Qué le hicieron? Lo estamos esperando"|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Goñi|first1=Uki|title=Argentina activist missing after indigenous people evicted from Benetton land|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/aug/08/argentina-santiago-maldonado-benetton-missing-activist|accessdate=26 August 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=8 August 2017}}</ref>
On October 20, 2017, Santiago's family confirmed that the body found floating in [[Chubut River]] was indeed his.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2073249-caso-santiago-maldonado-cuerpo-identificacion|title=Segio Maldonado: "Estamos convencidos de que es Santiago"|access-date=2017-10-20}}</ref> On October 21, a twelve-hour autopsy revealed no lesions in his body, leading experts to conclude that he had drowned.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2074332-confirman-que-el-cadaver-era-de-maldonado-y-evaluan-como-murio|title=El cadáver es de Maldonado y no tiene lesiones, reveló la autopsia|access-date=2017-10-21}}</ref> On November 24, 2017 the verdict of a commission of 55 forensic experts confirmed that Santiago Maldonado died by asphyxia and hypotermia; different studies showed that the corpse at the time of the autopsy was between 55 days and 72 days old. The experts also confirmed that there were no blows or injuries. Nevertheless, the defense insists that the case is a forced disapearance.<ref name="nueva"/> The case was closed on November 29, 2018, when judge Gustavo Lleral ruled that there was no forced disapearance.<ref name=cierran>{{cite web |url= https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2197521-el-juez-lleral-cerro-causa-donde-se|title= Cierran la causa por la muerte de Santiago Maldonado|trans-title= They close the Santiago Maldonado case|language= Spanish|author= Candela Ini|date= November 29, 2018|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 29, 2018}}</ref>
==The event== Santiago Andrés Maldonado (born 25 July 1989) was a craftsman and [[tattoo]] artist from the town of [[Veinticinco de Mayo, Buenos Aires|Veinticinco de Mayo]], [[province of Buenos Aires]]. A few months before his disappearance he had moved to [[El Bolsón, Río Negro|El Bolsón]], province of [[Río Negro Province|Río Negro]], about 70 kilometers north of a Mapuche settlement named Cushamen. Maldonado supported the aboriginal communities in their land claims, but, according to his family, he had never before been politically active because "he does not believe in politics".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-america-latina-40868877|title=Quién es Santiago Maldonado, el joven cuya desaparición tiene en vilo a Argentina|last=Smink|first=Veronica|date=2017-08-08|work=BBC Mundo|access-date=2017-09-17|language=en-GB}}</ref>
The event took place on July 31 and August 1, 2017, at the [[Chubut Province]]. The location was the Pu Lof de la Resistencia of Cushamen, a [[mapuche]] establishment built in territories seized from the Italian clothing company [[Benetton Group]] by Facundo Jones Huala. Huala, member of the [[Resistencia Ancestral Mapuche]] group,<ref name="pidio">{{cite web |url= https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2050635-cristina-kirchner-pidio-la-aparicion-con-vida-de-santiago-maldonado-y-responsabilizo-a-gendarmeria|title= Cristina Kirchner pidió la aparición con vida de Santiago Maldonado y responsabilizó a Gendarmería|trans-title= Cristina Kirchner asked for Santiago Maldonado to be returned alive and blamed the gendarmerie|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 6, 2018|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 30, 2018}}</ref> was jailed because of the violent protest activities including destruction of properties that undertook in several locations, and members of the Pu Lof organized a [[picketing]] protest at the [[National Route 40 (Argentina)|National Route 40]], advocating for his liberation.<ref name="ruta40"/> The people in the demonstration were hooded, and had completely blocked the road with trees, stones and fire, thus not allowing any transit through the road. The protest was carried out by eight people, Santiago Maldonado among them. Judge [[Guido Otranto]] instructed the [[Argentine National Gendarmerie]] to clear the blockade and disperse the protesters, who escaped. The judge had also instructed them to use minimal violence, and film the operation on video.<ref name="ruta40"/>
The protesters tried to block the road again some hours later, on August 1. The protesters reacted violently to the Gendarmerie this time, and attacked them with stones. Commander Juan Pablo Escola reported that two gendarmes were gravely injured in their faces during the attack. He sent a group of 30 gendarmes to the Pu Lof. Although he did not have a judicial warrant to do so, he considered that the attack could be considered as ''[[in flagrante delicto]]'', which would have allowed to skip that requirement.<ref name="ruta40"/>
Some protesters attempted to escape by swimming across the [[Chubut River]], and others tried to hide in a forest next to the river. Maldonado could not cross the river because he could not swim.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2062397-caso-maldonado-dos-gendarmes-avalaron-la-hipotesis-de-que-en-el-rio-hubo-un-manifestante-herido|title= Caso Maldonado: dos gendarmes avalaron la hipótesis de que en el río hubo un manifestante herido|trans-title=|language= Spanish|author= Loreley Gaffoglio|date= September 13, 2017|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 15, 2017}}</ref> The whereabouts of Santiago Maldonado were unknown after that point.<ref name="ruta40"/>
==Judicial case== A judicial case, led by a judge and three prosecutors, tries to determine the whereabouts of Maldonado. The national government<ref name="querellante">{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/caso-maldonado-gobierno-analiza-presentarse-querellante_0_ByFTly7FW.html|title= Caso Maldonado: el Gobierno analiza presentarse como querellante|trans-title=Maldonado case: the government considers to ask to be a complainant|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 29, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> and the provincial government of Chubut<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/caso-maldonado-gobierno-chubut-quiere-querellante_0_rkpL_bXK-.html|title= Caso Maldonado: también el Gobierno de Chubut quiere ser querellante|trans-title=Maldonado case: the government of Chubut wants to be complainant as well|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 29, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> asked to be complainants in the case. The [[Inter-American Commission on Human Rights]] suggested that, in case of doubt about a case being a forced disappearance or not, it should be investigated as if it was.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2017/08/24/world/americas/ap-lt-argentina-missing-activist.html|title= Rights Commission Urges Argentina to Find Missing Activist|author= |date= August 24, 2017|publisher= The New York Times|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> In line with this suggestion, the Gendarmerie was removed from taking an active role in the investigation.<ref name="querellante"/> The [[International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance|United Nations Committee on Enforced Disappearances]] has requested to oversee the investigation, which was accepted by Argentina. As a result, both the judiciary and the Argentine government will have to keep the organization updated about every progress of the investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.infobae.com/politica/2017/08/30/marcos-pena-lanza-la-campana-electoral-de-cambiemos-con-un-duro-mensaje-en-el-congreso/|title= Marcos Peña lanzará la campaña electoral de Cambiemos con un duro mensaje en el Congreso|trans-title=Marcos Peña launches the electoral campaign of Cambiemos with a harsh speech in the Congress|language= Spanish|author= Martín Dinatale|date= August 30, 2017|publisher= Infobae|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref>
The case was initially investigated as a [[search and rescue]], and was later rebranded as a [[forced disappearance]]. However, the change was made without any new evidence that may suggest an involvement of the Gendarmeria.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/fiscal-pide-caso-maldonado-investigado-desaparicion-forzada-personas_0_ByLaFq2O-.html|title= Cambia la carátula del caso Maldonado a "desaparición forzada de personas"|trans-title=The Maldonado case is changed to "forced disappearance of people"|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= August 24, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref>
A group of twenty mapuches [[Occupation (protest)|occupied]] the court on September 20, asking for the removal of judge Otranto.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/enojados-otranto-mapuches-toman-pacificamente-juzgado-esquel_0_S1jqY0JsZ.html|title= Sube la tensión en Esquel: mapuches toman el juzgado y piden que se vaya Otranto|trans-title=Tension is rising at Esquel: the court is occupied, amid requests for the removal of Otranto|language= Spanish|author= Guido Carelli Lynch|date= September 20, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref>
The Maldonado family and the CELS accused the judge Otranto of not being an [[impartial jury]]. The federal chamber of appeals of [[Comodoro Rivadavia]] recused him from the case, but clarified in the sentence that they found no reason to doubt his intellectual honesty and respect to the procedures. He was recused instead because of an interview with the newspaper ''[[La Nación]]'', where he made an extrajudicial commentary about the accuracy of the theories, before formally closing the case. Otranto was then replaced by judge [[Gustavo Llerald]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Desplazan al juez Otranto de la causa que investiga la desaparición de Santiago Maldonado|trans-title=They recuse judge Otranto from the case that investigates the disappearance of Santiago Maldonado|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2065517-desplazan-al-juez-otranto-de-la-causa-que-investiga-la-desaparicion-de-santiago-maldonado|language= Spanish|date=September 22, 2017|author=Ana Tronfi|publisher=La Nación|access-date=September 25, 2017}}</ref> The Maldonado family celebrated the removal of Otranto, but complained that their specific request had been rejected.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2065552-caso-maldonado-la-familia-celebro-que-apartaran-a-otranto-pero-se-quejo-de-los-fundamentos-de-la-camara|title= Caso Maldonado: la familia celebró que apartaran a Otranto, pero se quejó de los fundamentos de la Cámara|trans-title=Maldonado case: the family celebrated the removal of Otranto, but complained about the reasons of the chamber|language= Spanish|author= |date= September 22, 2017|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref> Otranto is still in charge of the case over the road block that started the case.<ref name="ruta40">{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/otranto-sigue-frente-causa-desalojo_0_rksganrjZ.html|title= A pesar de la recusación, Otranto sigue al frente de la causa por el desalojo de la ruta 40|trans-title=Despite the recusal, Otranto is still in charge of the case over the liberation of the Route 40|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= September 24, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref>
On 21 October 2017, after a 12-hour autopsy involving 52 experts, including those appointed by Maldonado's family, Judge Gustavo Lleral confirmed that Maldonado's body did not have any signs of violence and the cause of death was established as death by drowning. On November 24, 2017 the verdict of the 55 experts confirmed that Maldonado drowned and that there were no signs of violence on his body. How, when and why he died is still on investigation.<ref name="lanacion.com.ar">{{Cite news|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2085380-caso-maldonado-termino-la-junta-medica-conformada-para-establecer-como-y-por-que-murio-el-artesano|title=Caso Maldonado: los peritos coinciden en que murió por "asfixia por sumersión" y que el cuerpo no estuvo en tierra|access-date=2018-06-20|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-maldonado-lesiones-cuerpo-dijo-juez-autopsia_0_SkNyi4daW.html|title=Caso Maldonado: "No hubo lesiones en el cuerpo", dijo el juez tras la autopsia|date=21 October 2017|publisher=[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]]|accessdate=2017-10-22|language=es}}</ref>
The prosecutor Silvina Avila asked in December 2017 to change the folder of the case from [[forced disappearance]] to [[suspicious death]], on the grounds that the investigation did not reveal any clue that may support the forced disappearance hypothesis. There was a similar request from the Ministry of Security in May 2018. The judge Lleral rejected both requests. He pointed that the folder of the case is inconsequential, that changing it before the case was closed would be an improper advance of opinion, and that the case is not guided by the folder's name but by the results of the investigations.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-maldonado-juez-mantuvo-caratula-causa-desaparicion-forzada_0_HJ1-dpnTf.html|title= Caso Maldonado: el juez mantuvo la carátula de la causa como "desaparición forzada"|trans-title= Maldonado case: the judge kept the folder of the case as "forced dissapearace"|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= May 6, 2018|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 20, 2018}}</ref> There are no specific members of the gendarmerie formally accused of wrongdoing or called for inquiry, which turns it into a moot point.<ref name="nueva"/>
==International cases== On August 7, 2017, the UN Committee on Enforced Disappearances expressed its "concern about the physical and psychological integrity" of Maldonado and requested the Argentine state to adopt "a comprehensive search strategy", taking "all the urgent measures that are necessary to search for him and find him, taking into account the information provided by the members of the Pu Lof Mapuche community that were present at the moment of the repression".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cels.org.ar/web/en/2017/08/el-comite-contra-la-desaparicion-forzada-de-la-onu-exige-la-accion-urgente/ |title=Santiago Maldonado's Disappearance in Argentina: The UN Committee on Enforced Disappearances demands urgent state action |date= August 7, 2017 |publisher= CELS - Centro de Estudios Legales y Sociales |accessdate=September 16, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://elpaisdigital.com.ar/contenido/la-onu-pide-acciones-urgentes-para-encontrar-a-maldonado/10122|title=La ONU pide al Estado argentino acciones urgentes para encontrar a Santiago Maldonado|last=Digital|first=El País|website=El País Digital|language=es|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref> The UN committee also requested that the Gendarmerie does not participate in the search and investigation of the disappearance and that the Argentine government protects all the evidence that may help to identify those responsible for the disappearance. The same day, the Minister of Security offered a reward to those who "while not having participated in the crime, offer useful information that can help find the whereabouts" of Maldonado.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.minseg.gob.ar/el-ministerio-de-seguridad-de-la-nación-informa-santiago-maldonado|title=El Ministerio de Seguridad de la Nación informa: Santiago Maldonado|date=2017-08-07|website=minseg.gob.ar|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref>
On August 23, the [[Inter-American Commission on Human Rights]] (IACHR), of the [[Organization of American States]], also took a precautionary measure asking the Argentine state to "adopt all the necessary measures to determine the situation and whereabouts of Mr. Santiago Maldonado" and to "inform about all the measures that have been adopted to investigate the facts".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/58474-el-derecho-a-la-vida-se-encuentra-en-grave-riesgo|title="El derecho a la vida se encuentra en grave riesgo" {{!}} Como había adelantado PáginaI12, la CIDH le exigió al Gobierno que determine "la situación y el paradero" de Santiago Maldonado|last=Meyer|first=Adriana|date=2017-08-24|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-AR}}</ref>
On October 6, the UN Committee on Enforced Disappearances published a document addressed to the Argentine national government in which the former expresses its concern about the lack of progress in the clarification of what happened to Santiago Maldonado. The UN demanded the Macri administration to set as a priority the clarification of the role of the Gendarmerie and to keep this force away from the investigation. It also accused the authorities of quickly rejecting the hypothesis according to which the Gendarmerie is the perpetrator of the enforced disappearance of Maldonado. The Committee expressed its concern regarding the lack of partiality of judge Guido Otranto. It finally pointed out that there are officials of the Macri administration that continue to stigmatize the members of the Pu Lof by portraying them as a threat to national security, when the government should be instead offering protection to the Mapuche community.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.infobae.com/sociedad/policiales/2017/10/06/la-onu-dura-contra-el-gobierno-por-el-caso-maldonado-pidio-esclarecer-en-forma-prioritaria-la-participacion-de-gendarmeria/|title=La ONU, dura contra el Gobierno por el caso Maldonado: pidió esclarecer en "forma prioritaria" la participación de Gendarmería|work=Infobae|access-date=2017-10-12|language=es-LA}}</ref>
The UN and the IACHR closed those cases on January 2018, a pair of months after Maldonado was found.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/onu-cerro-investigacion-caso-santiago-maldonado_0_HyEndWUSG.html|title= La ONU también cerró una investigación sobre el caso Santiago Maldonado|trans-title= The UN also closed an investigation about the Santiago Maldonado case|language= Spanish|author= Natasha Niebieskikwiat|date= January 24, 2018|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 20, 2018}}</ref>
==Drowned== Maldonado escaped from the Gendarmerie by trying to cross the [[Chubut River]]. A new search revealed a corpse in the river on October 17.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-maldonado-encontraron-cuerpo-rio-chubut_0_rkg9SdAX6W.html|title= Caso Santiago Maldonado: encontraron un cuerpo en el Río Chubut|trans-title=Maldonado case: they found a corpse at the Chubut river|language= Spanish|author= |date= October 17, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=October 9, 2017}}</ref> There were no reports of other deaths or missing people in the area, and it was confirmed that it was a male, with light blue clothes as those that witnesses reported that Maldonado was wearing.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-santiago-maldonado-fiscal-avila-confirmo-cuerpo-masculino-lleva-ropa-celeste-dijeron-testigos_0_BJ52C-NTb.html|title= Caso Santiago Maldonado: la fiscal Ávila confirmó que "es un cuerpo masculino y lleva ropa celeste como la que dijeron los testigos"|trans-title=Maldonado case: prosecutor Ávila confirmed that "it is a male body and has light blue clothes, as reported by witnesses"|language= Spanish|author= Guido Braslavsky|date= October 17, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=October 9, 2017}}</ref> The corpse was found 300 meters upstream from the area of the events.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/caso-maldonado-fiscalia-cuerpo-encontrado-300-metros-rio-arriba_0_BkpjOzVa-.html|title= Caso Maldonado: según la fiscalía, el cuerpo fue encontrado "300 metros río arriba"|trans-title=Maldonado case: according to the prosecutor, the corpse was found "300 meter upstream"|language= Spanish|author= |date= October 17, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=October 9, 2017}}</ref>
Newspaper [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarin]] said that the hypothesis of the government was that the presence of many [[River ecosystem|aquatic plants]] and strong flows could make it difficult to find the corpse.<ref name="dos">{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/hipotesis-gobierno-caso-maldonado-ahogo-protesta_0_HkV71bk2-.html|title= Dos hipótesis del Gobierno en el caso Maldonado: o se ahogó o no estuvo en la protesta|trans-title=Two hypothesis of the government in the Maldonado case: he either drowned or was't in the protest|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= October 1, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 29, 2017}}</ref> The autopsy conducted on 21 October 2017 confirmed forensic evidence clearly pointed to drowning and hypotermia as the cause of death<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.clarin.com/politica/ahogamiento-hipotermia-detalles-autopsia-santiago-maldonado_0_HyXCuMFab.html|title=Ahogamiento, hipotermia y todos los detalles de la autopsia de Santiago Maldonado|access-date=2017-10-21}}</ref> The autopsy, witnessed by 52 experts including that of the Maldonado family and international organizations, revealed no evidence of injuries. The corpse was acknowledged to be Maldonado's by the 52 experts witnessing the autopsy. On November 29, 2018 Judge Lleral closed the case citing no further evidence pointing towards anything different to an accidental drowning.<ref name=cierran/>
==Maldonado's legal plans== Despite of the recovery of the body, and the results of the autopsy, the defense of the Maldonado family insists that the case was a forced disappearance. They consider that he had been taken and killed by the gendarmerie elsewhere, and then his body was planted into the crime scene. They say that the body presents signs of [[cryopreservation]], although the autopsy does not reveal such signs. This theory does not provide an explanation to the absence of any signs of manipulation of the body, or the way the gendarmerie could have sneaked into a location closely watched by the mapuches.<ref name="nueva"/>
The Maldonado family requested a deeper autopsy study, and a new autopsy by independent people. The judge rejected both requests. He considered that the results of the autopsy were clear enough, and that an autopsy by outside people would go against the sovereignty of the judicial power. The defense asked for big number of investigations, that the judge systematically rejects as extemporaneous, pointless or impossible to perform. Those rejected investigations would be cited in later judicial stages, and even in a potential international case once all the local judicial venues are done, to argue an [[obstruction of justice]].<ref name="nueva">{{cite web |url= https://www.infobae.com/sociedad/policiales/2018/10/21/caso-maldonado-como-es-la-nueva-estrategia-judicial-que-plantea-la-familia-para-lograr-una-condena-al-estado/|title= Caso Maldonado: cómo es la nueva estrategia judicial que plantea la familia para lograr una condena al Estado|trans-title= Maldonado case: Which is the new judicial strategy by the family to get a sentence against the state|language= Spanish|author= Loreley Gaffoglio|date= October 21, 2018|publisher= Infobae|accessdate=October 29, 2018}}</ref>
== Former hypothesis ==
=== Forced disappearance ===
According to witnesses, after the Argentine National Gendarmerie had an encounter with the Lof, agents from this security force carried somebody to a truck.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/57776-una-historia-de-mentiras-y-encubrimiento|title=Una historia de mentiras y encubrimiento {{!}} Página/12 accedió al expediente por la desaparición forzada de Santiago Maldonado|last=Meyer|first=Adriana|date=2017-08-20|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-AR}}</ref> Later those witnesses admitted to lying to the court and are facing perjury charges. The Gendarmerie denies having detained Maldonado, so does the minister of security, Patricia Bullrich.
The witnesses made public comments, but refused to testify in court.<ref name="missing">{{cite web |url= https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-41066685|title= Where is Santiago Maldonado? Argentina searches for missing protester|author= |date= August 27, 2017|publisher= BBC|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> They proposed to testify while concealing their identities with hoods, which was rejected by the judiciary.<ref name="primeros"/> Other witnesses told before justice that Maldonado was taken by Gendarmerie agents.<ref name="primeros">{{cite news|last1=Devanna|first1=Cecilia|title=Los primeros testigos declararon ante fiscales|trans-title=The first witnesses declared before prosecutors|url=http://www.perfil.com/politica/los-primeros-testigos-declararon-ante-fiscales.phtml|accessdate=26 August 2017|work=[[Perfil]]|date=13 August 2017|language=Spanish}}</ref>
Eighty biological samples were retrieved from the vehicles used by the Gendarmerie during the operation, and used for a DNA test. Another fourteen samples were ignored, as they were unsuitable for testing. The results were released a month later: none of them matched the DNA of Maldonado.<ref name="noes">{{cite web |url= http://www.infobae.com/sociedad/policiales/2017/09/12/caso-maldonado-la-prueba-de-adn-en-la-camioneta-de-gendarmeria-dio-negativa/|title= El ADN hallado en las camionetas de la Gendarmería no es de Santiago Maldonado|trans-title=The DNA found at the Gendarmerie trucks do not belong to Maldonado|language= Spanish|author= |date= September 12, 2017|publisher= Infobae|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref> The value of this evidence has been disputed by public defender Fernando Machado, who argued that the samples would have been taken after the trucks had been washed. The judge dismissed those concerns.<ref name="noes"/>
The prosecutor Silvina Avila made a report that established that there are no solid evidences that link the Gendarmerie with Maldonado.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/caso-maldonado-fiscal-confirma-debiles-pruebas-gendarmeria_0_r15R9PXtW.html|title= Caso Maldonado: la fiscal confirma que son débiles las pruebas contra Gendarmería|trans-title=Maldonado case: the prosecutor confirms that the proofs against the Gendarmerie are weak|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= August 29, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> As of September 17, the judge does not consider the theory of a forced disappearance to be likely.<ref name="ahogo">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2063758-el-juez-guido-otranto-la-hipotesis-mas-razonable-es-que-maldonado-se-ahogo|title= El juez Guido Otranto: "La hipótesis más razonable es que Maldonado se ahogó"|trans-title=The judge Guido Otranto: "The most reasonable theory is that Maldonado drowned"|language= Spanish|author= Loreley Gaffoglio|date= September 17, 2017|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 15, 2017}}</ref>
Audio files were taken from [[WhatsApp]] conversations held by those involved in the operation on the day. One of the files, sent by a member of the gendarmeria, states that a sergeant had "Maldonado in a truck".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2065471-otro-audio-de-gendarmeria-dijo-que-el-que-tenia-a-maldonado-en-la-camioneta-era-la-sargento-sartirana|title=Otro audio de Gendarmería: "Dijo que el que tenía a Maldonado en la camioneta era la sargento Sartirana"|access-date=2017-09-22}}</ref> A more detailed analysis revealed that the comment was made on August 16, only as part of a private joke between members of the Gendarmerie while Bullrich explained the case to the Congress.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/politica/desafortunado-chiste-gendarmes-genero-confusion-caso-maldonado_0_BJ5YeWQjW.html|title= Un desafortunado chiste entre gendarmes generó una confusión más en el Caso Maldonado|trans-title=An unfortunate joke between Gendarmerie members caused further confusion in the Maldonado case|language= Spanish|author= Claudio Andrade|date= September 22, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref> All 70 cell phones of the gendarmes were investigated, and none of them had been used to discuss an actual forced disappearance operation.<ref name="dos" />
Ariel Garzi, a fellow craftsman from El Bolsón, called Santiago Maldonado's cellphone on August 2. The call was answered by an unknown person. It lasted 22 seconds, during which Garzi heard the sound of steps.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://latinta.com.ar/2017/08/testigo-clave-ariel-garzi-llamada/|title=Testigo del caso Maldonado: una llamada, 22 segundos y el ruido de las botas|date=2017-08-22|work=La tinta|access-date=2017-10-01|language=es-ES}}</ref> Ariel Garbanz, an engineer from the Communications Security Lab of the [[National Technological University]], investigated the call and claims to know the location where the phone was answered. Judge Otranto refused to look at this evidence.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201709/202874-especialista-asegura-tener-probado-donde-se-activo-el-celular-de-maldonado-un-dia-despues-de-su-desaparicion.html|title=Un especialista asegura tener probado dónde se activó el celular de Maldonado un día después de su desaparición|website=www.telam.com.ar|access-date=2017-10-01}}</ref>
===Received a mortal wound=== Maldonado could have received a mortal wound during the escape, which would have caused his death at some later point. The Mapuches may have buried the body and then made up an accusation about an alleged forced disappearance in order to advance their political agenda.<ref name="hipo">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2062433-caso-maldonado-los-tres-escenarios-que-plantean-los-investigadores|title= La desaparición de Santiago Maldonado: las tres hipótesis que plantean los investigadores|trans-title=The disappearance of Santiago Maldonado: the three hypotheses held by investigators|language= Spanish|author= Loreley Gaffoglio|date= September 13, 2017|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 15, 2017}}</ref>
===Hiding=== A theory considered that Maldonado was still alive, hiding in Mapuche territory. A search with [[search and rescue dog]]s conducted on August 16 suggested that he would have been in the area in the previous 24 hours.<ref name="hipo"/>
The government also considered that Maldonado may have never been in the protest to begin with. As all people in the protest were hooded, it was not possible to properly recognize him in photos or filmings of the event. The Maldonado family reported that he was a quiet and peaceful man, which would make it unlikely that he would take part in a violent protest in a road. The mapuches Beatriz Garay Neri, Soraya Noemí Guitart and Nicolás Jones Huala reported that they talked with him on August 1, in the morning, but did not provide further details about his presence or the topics of discussion. They did not report his absence either, and ignored his full name.<ref name="dos" />
===Murder=== Santiago Maldonado used his cell phone for the last time on July 21, 2017. That day, four or five hooded members of the [[Resistencia Ancestral Mapuche]] invaded the small house of Evaristo Jones, a worker for the Benetton family. Jones reported that he tried to defend himself by stabbing one of those people with a knife. As there are no cases of knife injuries treated in nearby hospitals on that day, or info about Maldonado's activities in the immediate days prior to the August 1 protest, it is suspected that he may be the stabbed thief, and that he had bled to death days before the protest.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/creen-artesano-uso-ultima-vez-celular-10-dias-desaparecer_0_BknB_oQuW.html|title= Creen que el artesano usó por última vez su celular 10 días antes de desaparecer|trans-title=It is considered that the craftman used his cell phone for the last time 10 days before disappearing|language= Spanish|author= Claudia Andrade|date= August 17, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref>
The family of Maldonado tried to refute this theory by providing a video of another picketing protest of the RAM that took place on July 31, which would have been attended by Maldonado.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2057718-la-familia-de-santiago-maldonado-presento-un-video-donde-se-lo-veria-cortando-la-ruta-40|title= La Justicia analiza un video aportado por la familia de Santiago Maldonado|trans-title=|language= Spanish|author= |date= |publisher= |accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref> They also provide testimonials from numerous people who saw Santiago after the supposed attack.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.santiagomaldonado.com/recomendamos-leer-los-ultimos-dias-santiago-cuatro-testimonios-desmienten-la-hipotesis-del-gobierno/|title=Recomendamos leer: Los últimos días de Santiago, cuatro testimonios que desmienten la hipótesis del gobierno - Santiago Maldonado|date=2017-08-24|work=Santiago Maldonado|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref> In addition, Evaristo Jones, the attacked worker, denied having hurt any of the attackers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.laizquierdadiario.com/Santiago-Maldonado-el-puestero-niega-las-versiones-del-Gobierno|title=Santiago Maldonado: el puestero niega las versiones del Gobierno|last=Pagés|first=Gloria|work=La Izquierda Diario|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-LA}}</ref> The Maldonado family also affirms that they had telephone conversations with Santiago on July 25 (his birthday) and on July 27.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.santiagomaldonado.com/las-fotos-se-estan-distribuyendo-whatsapp/|title=Sobre las fotos que se están distribuyendo por Whatsapp. - Santiago Maldonado|date=2017-09-03|work=Santiago Maldonado|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref>
Through DNA tests it was proved that Santiago Maldonado was not injured in said episode.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cij.gov.ar/nota-27424-Caso-Santiago-Maldonado--comunicado-del-Juzgado-Federal-de-Esquel.html|title=Caso Santiago Maldonado: comunicado del Juzgado Federal de Esquel|last=Judicial|first=CIJ - Centro de Información|website=cij.gov.ar|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref>
==Reactions== [[File:Acto Plaza de Mayo Aparición Santiago Maldonado.jpg|thumb|A demonstration in [[Buenos Aires]]]] Argentine human rights organizations condemned the disappearance, demanding the national government to adopt measures to bring back Maldonado alive, find who is responsible for the disappearance, and keep the Gendarmerie away from the investigation.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2052365-desde-adentro-la-intimidad-de-la-marcha-por-la-aparicion-con-vida-de-santiago-maldonado|title=Desde adentro: la intimidad de la marcha por la aparición con vida de Santiago Maldonado|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref> They have also accused the government of not acting diligently to find Maldonado.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cadena3.com/contenido/2017/08/23/Hay-un-negacionismo-total-del-Gobierno-dijo-Taty-Almeida-190469.asp|title=Hay un negacionismo total del Gobierno, dijo Taty Almeida|last=Argentina|first=Cadena 3|work=Cadena 3 Argentina|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-LA}}</ref>
The disappearance of Maldonado has also mobilized international human rights organizations, such as [[Amnesty International]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.amnestyusa.org/urgent-actions/urgent-action-forced-disappearance-in-mapuche-community-argentina-ua-191-17/|title=Urgent Action: Forced Disappearance In Mapuche Community (Argentina: UA 191.17) – Amnesty International USA|work=Amnesty International USA|access-date=2017-09-17|language=en-US}}</ref> and [[Human Rights Watch]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/08/16/disappearance-protestor-argentina|title=Disappearance of Protestor in Argentina|date=2017-08-16|work=Human Rights Watch|access-date=2017-09-17|language=en}}</ref> In Buenos Aires, La Plata, Bariloche, Mar del Plata, Bahía Blanca, General Madariaga, Mendoza, Malargüe, El Bolsón, Rawson, Viedma, Gualeguaychú, Rosario and Neuquen thousands of people marched in demonstrations demanding that Maldonado appears alive and the resignation of Bullrich.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-41133865 |title=Santiago Maldonado: Thousands march for missing activist |date= September 2, 2017 |publisher= BBC |accessdate=September 16, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/55075-aparicion-con-vida-ya|title="¡Aparición con vida ya!" {{!}} La ONU le exigió al Estado argentino que encuentre a Santiago Maldonado|date=2017-08-07|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-AR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://redaccionrosario.com/2017/08/08/rosario-marcha-junto-a-madres-por-santiago-maldonado/|title=Rosario marcha junto a Madres por Santiago Maldonado|last=Rosario|first=Redacción|date=2017-08-08|work=Redacción Rosario|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref> People also marched to demand that Santiago Maldonado is brought back alive in Bogotá (Colombia), Asunción (Paraguay), Montevideo (Uruguay), Canelones and Fray Bentos (Uruguay).<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.planbnoticias.com.ar/pb/index.php/2017/08/07/marchas-en-gran-parte-del-pais-exigen-la-aparicion-de-santiago-maldonado/|title=Marchas en gran parte del país: exigen la aparición de Santiago Maldonado|date=2017-08-07|work=Plan B Noticias|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170808033259/http://www.planbnoticias.com.ar/pb/index.php/2017/08/07/marchas-en-gran-parte-del-pais-exigen-la-aparicion-de-santiago-maldonado/|archivedate=2017-08-08|df=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.infobaires24.com.ar/uruguay-marcho-la-aparicion-vida-santiago-maldonado/|title=Uruguay marchò por la "aparición con vida" de Santiago Maldonado - InfoBaires24|date=2017-08-11|work=InfoBaires24|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref> In Spain, several Argentine residents marched to Plaça de Catalunya to ask for Santiago Maldonado.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://diariohoy.net/interes-general/en-europa-tambien-piden-por-la-aparicion-de-santiago-maldonado-102516|title=En Europa también piden por la aparición de Santiago Maldonado {{!}} Diario Hoy|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref> On August 11, there was a large mass demonstration in Plaza de Mayo, Buenos Aires. On August 21, during the 49th ordinary session of PARLASUR, in Montevideo, Argentine representatives condemned the disappearance of Santiago Maldonado.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.tn24.com.ar/2017/08/parlasur-exige-aparicion-con-vida-de-santiago-maldonado/|title=PARLASUR exige aparición con vida de Santiago Maldonado {{!}} {{!}} TN24|date=2017-08-24|work=TN24|access-date=2017-09-17|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mundo.sputniknews.com/americalatina/201708221071756431-santiago-maldonado-parlasur-argentina/|title="Es gravísimo que haya una desaparición forzada en Argentina"|last=Sputnik|website=mundo.sputniknews.com|language=es|access-date=2017-09-17}}</ref>
The disappearance of Maldonado took place shortly before the [[Argentine legislative election, 2017|2017 midterm elections]]. [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]], leader of one of the opposition parties, mentioned the case repeatedly during her rallies.<ref name="missing"/> Kirchner and several Kirchnerite politicians used it to draw controversial comparisons between the [[presidency of Mauricio Macri]] and the 1970s [[Dirty War]]. However, political analysts consider that the case is unlikely to affect the election results, and that the aggressive rhetoric of Kirchner may actually scare independent voters and increase the chances of the ''[[Cambiemos]]'' official coalition.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2059170-santiago-maldonado-un-salvavidas-para-cristina-kirchner|title= Santiago Maldonado, ¿un salvavidas para Cristina Kirchner?|trans-title=Santiago Maldonado, a life jacket for Cristina Kirchner?|language= Spanish|author= Fernando Laborda|date= September 3, 2017|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 29, 2017}}</ref> the corpse of Maldonado was found a few days before the elections. By the time of voting, the Maldonado family had confirmed his identity and the initial autopsy revealed no signs of violence against the body; the official results of the full autopsy would be released a pair of weeks later.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://elpais.com/internacional/2017/10/20/argentina/1508536687_321209.html|title= La autopsia certifica que Santiago Maldonado no fue disparado ni golpeado|trans-title= The autopsy confirms that Maldonado has not been shot or attacked|language= Spanish|author= Carlos Cue|date= October 21, 2017|publisher= El País|accessdate=September 20, 2018}}</ref>
August 30 is the [[International Day of the Disappeared]], and several teachers affiliated to the CTERA union mentioned the event during school classes. This action was rejected by groups of parents because it described the involvement of the Gendarmerie as a confirmed fact, and it was considered a case of political [[indoctrination]].<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.clarin.com/sociedad/caso-maldonado-escuelas-padres-indignacion-respaldo_0_ry32n84tb.html|title= Caso Maldonado en las escuelas: los padres, entre la indignación y el respaldo|trans-title=Maldonado case: parents, torn between indignation and support|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 30, 2017|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=August 26, 2017}}</ref>
The Macri administration first negated the disappearance of Maldonado. As the days went by, members of Mr. Macri's cabinet send contradictory messages.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.economist.com/news/americas/21728673-disappearance-young-man-patagonia-evokes-painful-memories-missing-person-case |title=A missing-person case looms over Argentina's midterm elections - The disappearance of a young man in Patagonia evokes painful memories |date= September 7, 2017 |publisher= The Econimist |accessdate=September 16, 2017}}</ref>
[[File:Desde Colonia preguntamos Dónde está Santiago Maldonado?.jpg|thumb|Demonstrators in [[Uruguay]] ask for the whereabouts of Santiago Maldonado]] On September 1, 2017, a month after Santiago Maldonado's disappearance, thousands of people expressed themselves through rallies and demonstrations asking for his appearance alive. The largest demonstration took place in [[Plaza de Mayo]] and was organized by [[Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo]], [[Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo]] (Línea Fundadora), Relatives of the Disappeared and Imprisoned for Political Reasons, [[HIJOS]], the Center for Legal and Social Studies (CELS), the Argentine League for the Rights of Man, and the Permanent Assembly for Human Rights, among other organizations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201709/199807-marcha-santiago-maldonado.html|title=Sergio Maldonado: "A la ministra de Seguridad le pido que dé un paso al costado"|website=www.telam.com.ar|access-date=2017-09-21}}</ref> In other cities, such as [[Mendoza, Argentina|Mendoza]], [[Mar del Plata]], [[San Luis, Argentina|San Luis]], [[San Juan, Argentina|San Juan]], [[Neuquén]], [[Salta]], [[Posadas, Argentina|Posadas]], [[San Salvador de Jujuy|Jujuy]], [[Santiago del Estero]], [[Villaguay]], [[Concepción del Uruguay]], [[Gualeguaychú, Entre Ríos|Gualeguaychú]] and [[Concordia, Argentina|Concordia]] there were rallies and demonstrations with the same demand.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201709/199865-marchas-actos-pedido-aparicion-santiago-maldonado-ciudades-provincias-argentina.html|title=El pedido por Santiago Maldonado también se replicó en varias ciudades del país|website=www.telam.com.ar|access-date=2017-09-21}}</ref> In Rosario and Córdoba there were rallies with an attendance of 40000 each.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lacapital.com.ar/la-ciudad/unas-40-mil-personas-se-congregaron-rosario-reclamar-la-aparicion-santiago-maldonado-n1462297.html|title=Unas 40 mil personas se congregaron en Rosario para reclamar por Santiago Maldonado|work=La Capital|access-date=2017-09-21|language=es-AR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cba24n.com.ar/content/santiago-maldonado-%C2%BFcomo-sera-la-marcha-en-cordoba|title=Córdoba marchó por la aparición de Santiago Maldonado|work=Cba24n|access-date=2017-09-21|language=es}}</ref> There were also protests in Spain, Brazil, France, Uruguay, Chile, Mexico, Austria and the United States which were organized through social media.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201709/199851-londres-manifestacion-santiago-maldonado.html|title=Argentinos y británicos se manifestaron por la aparición de Santiago Maldonado|website=www.telam.com.ar|access-date=2017-09-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cronica.com.ar/mundo/El-mundo-reclama-la-aparicion-de-Santiago-Maldonado-20170901-0034.html|title=El mundo reclama la aparición de Santiago Maldonado|work=Crónica|access-date=2017-09-21|language=es}}</ref> In London,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pagina12.com.ar/60386-tambien-en-el-exterior|title=También en el exterior {{!}} El reclamo por Maldonado llegó hasta Londres|last=Justo|first=Marcelo|work=PAGINA12|access-date=2017-09-21|language=es-AR}}</ref> São Paulo, Berlin, Montevideo, Rio de Janeiro, Madrid, Barcelona, Sidney, Santiago, Mexico City, Vienna, Washington DC and New York City, groups of people expressed their solidarity with the demand for the appearance of Santiago Maldonado alive.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://diariohoy.net/politica/la-argentina-y-el-mundo-reclamaron-su-aparicion-con-vida-104153|title=La Argentina y el mundo reclamaron su aparición con vida {{!}} Diario Hoy|access-date=2017-09-21|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eldia.com/nota/2017-9-1-20-22-0-el-pedido-por-la-aparicion-de-santiago-maldonado-traspaso-las-fronteras-el-pais|title=El pedido por la aparición de Santiago Maldonado traspasó las fronteras|last=www.eldia.com|first=Diario El Dia de La Plata|website=www.eldia.com|language=es|access-date=2017-09-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eldiario.com.ar/sociedad/el-pedido-de-aparicioacuten-con-vida-de-santiago-fue-internacional-1.htm|title=El pedido de aparición con vida de Santiago fue internacional - Sociedad - El diario|last=Technologies|first=Advertis Web|website=El pedido de aparición con vida de Santiago fue internacional - Sociedad - El diario|language=es-LA|access-date=2017-09-21}}</ref>
==See also== * [[List of solved missing persons cases]]
